text: Two ships of the United States Navy have borne the name Batfish, named in honor of the batfish, any of several fishes; a pediculate fish of the West Indies, the flying gurnard of the Atlantic, or a California sting ray. * , was a Balao-class submarine, commissioned in 1943 and struck in 1972. * , was a Sturgeon-class submarine, commissioned in 1972 and struck in 1999. ==Sources== * Category:United States Navy ship names
title: USS Batfish
